Superman.Action: Flies at the speed of light into another galaxy and successfully hurls a warhead into outer space, neutralizing a threat.
Transforms from Superman to Clark Kent with ease and walks jauntily towards Metropolis, blending in quietly after an ordeal.
Thanks Lois and Jimmy in good spirits, engages in light-hearted banter, showing appreciation.
Exhibits subtle sadness or unrequited love for Lois while maintaining a friendly and humorous facade.
Successfully lands unobserved at a garbage dump despite recent ordeal, then changes into Clark Kent and blends into the city unnoticed.
Keeps emotional composure despite looking tired or bushed from recent events.
Engages in light-hearted banter showing social confidence and situational awareness.
Clark shows self-deprecating humor and vulnerability about his perceived shortcomings compared to Superman.
Clark listens patiently and shows hopefulness when Lois compliments him, indicating openness and sincerity.
Clark accepts Lois's constructive criticism without defensiveness, showing willingness to improve.
Clark's internal miffed reaction to jealousy shows some insecurity, but not hostility or coldness.
Clark is often late and uses excuses like 'stuck in traffic,' showing a lack of punctuality and preparedness.
Clark displays hesitance and lacks assertiveness in his professional life, missing chances to be a top reporter.
Clark shows a hopeful and positive attitude when Lois says he has everything, reflecting some confidence.
Thanks Lois sincerely for her advice before; expresses appreciation genuinely.
Eagerly pursues Lois's personal remark, showing interest in her feelings.
Is focused and attentive, taking notes on the developing crisis, indicating awareness and mental engagement.
Does not immediately notice Lois leaving, showing a slight lapse in situational awareness.
Clark Kent arrives quickly at the scene, running to the elevators and searching for a way to reach the terrorists.
Clark chooses to take the fire stairs instead of the elevator to reach the terrorists, showing situational awareness and decisiveness.
Clark is not seen by the Cop who searches the stairs, implying he is stealthy or able to evade detection.
Remains passive or absent during the terrorist standoff, allowing hostages and Lois to be taken at gunpoint without intervention.
Clark (Superman) offers to get Superman for the terrorists to protect the hostages, stalling to buy time.

Clark (Superman) quickly speaks up to stall the terrorists and tries to manipulate their expectations by pretending he can call Superman and bring him quickly, showing presence of mind and quick thinking.
Clark appears helpless and worried initially while Lois is threatened, showing a moment of vulnerability but then recovers.
Calmly allows terrorists to escort him under control while trying to achieve his goal of using the phone, shows patience and strategic restraint rather than rashness.
Attempts to stall and retrieve the phone number while being closely monitored and frisked by terrorists, demonstrating presence of mind under pressure.
Uses physical force efficiently to disarm terrorists quickly and protect others.
Waits calmly after subduing enemies, showing control and care for safety.
Responds immediately to Lois' danger, fights the Terrorist decisively, catches Lois mid-fall, gently smoothes her skirt, and places her safely on the pavement.
Maintains focus after Lois is thrown off the ledge and swiftly knocks out the terrorist before rescuing Lois in time.
Immediately smoothes Lois's skirt and gently places her on the pavement after catching her, showing care and attention to detail.
Three terrorists permanently out of circulation, and last week he sent Lex Luthor up the river.
Nabs a bunch of radical freaks on a roof, preventing casualties.
Successfully prevents thousands of deaths from Luthor's West Coast destruction plan.
Eludes all conventional tracking methods including radar due to his super-speed and secretive movements.
Disappears to an unknown northern location that even advanced tracking devices fail to identify.
Takes Lois’s feelings into account, makes a light joke to ease tension, and offers her an orchid awkwardly, showing kindness and attentiveness.
Expresses concern about exploitation of newlyweds, showing moral seriousness.
Notices a bucket of champagne with a card, finds a positive detail in a generally bad situation.
Attempts to pin a corsage on Lois awkwardly, showing social awkwardness.
Makes a serious comment about exposing a racket exploiting newlyweds.
Gets flustered and hesitant when discussing sleeping arrangements, showing some insecurity or nervousness.
No direct action observed in the excerpt; appears absent or passive during Lex Luthor's exploration of the Fortress of Solitude.
Not present or acting in this excerpt; the scene centers on others exploring the Fortress of Solitude while Superman is absent.
Sits confidently on the throne to activate memory cells and interact with his father's recordings in the Fortress of Solitude.
Following his father's admonition to use his powers for the good of mankind and not set himself above others.
Uses the memory cells in order and follows the instruction from Jor-El's recording to learn and prepare himself.
No direct action in the excerpt; inference only from pattern of behavior taking memory cells in order, indicating methodical, careful approach.
Listens attentively to Jor-El's education material about Earth culture, showing willingness to learn.
No direct action or statement shown in this excerpt indicating indecision or failure.
As a baby, Kal-El reacts negatively to attempts at friendly engagement by others (Jak-El making a face to amuse him, Ursa turning away with disgust).
No direct action in this excerpt; context mainly about background and other characters, no demonstration of skill, intelligence, or confidence by Superman.
No direct action or statement in this excerpt; observes a tense political negotiation between Jor-El and Zod, with no personal warmth expressed or evinced.
Analyzes political intrigue carefully, recognizes underlying motivations and pressure tactics from Zod and Ursa.
Considers the offer with measured thought before responding, showing strategic patience.
Displays calm confidence and decisive anger during confrontation; effectively stands up to enemies with a strategic gesture (hurling the gift box), intimidating opponents and causing them to retreat.
Clarks stands with Lois, observing couples holding hands, gently pressing Lois to hold his hand, showing care and a desire for closeness.
Pulls Freddy to safety when he loses footing and almost falls.
Patiently waits in a long line at the hot dog stand despite boredom.
Swoops in to save Freddy from falling into the rapids at Niagara Falls.
Saves a child who is about to fall over Niagara Falls at the last moment with great speed and skill.
Intervenes to protect a child in danger confidently and efficiently.
Rescues a child from danger, returns him safely to his mother, and engages warmly with the child by jokingly limiting 'one ride to a customer'.
Leaves abruptly after rescue, ignoring Lois's attempt to get his attention, causing her to feel dejected.
After transforming into Clark Kent, picks up two hot dogs and heads back toward the crowd, implying a gesture of sharing or caring.
Swoops in at the last second to save a child from danger, delivering the child safely to the mother, earning cheers and applause.
Offers a witty, confident remark ('Sorry, only one ride to a customer.') after rescue, indicating calm control and ease in the situation.
Flies off quickly after the rescue, ignoring Lois who tries to get his attention.
Leaves a dollar on the hot dog counter after hesitating to pay.
Attempts to deflect Lois's probing questions with casual, somewhat evasive answers.
Turns away in irritation when confronted by Lois about his secret.
Transforms skillfully and inconspicuously from Superman to Clark Kent, showing control and awareness.
Leaves a dollar anonymously to pay for hot dogs, showing responsible and honest behavior.
Attempts to deflect Lois's suspicions with casual remarks and minor distractions.
Appears nervous and tries to avoid direct confrontation when Lois nearly exposes his identity.
Maintains a defensive posture and uses vague denials under pressure from Lois.
Follows Lois to the dangerous bridge, shows anxiety and concern for her well-being.
Laughs off Lois's serious bet on her life, initially dismissive of her conviction.
Follows Lois anxiously onto the bridge and tries to reason with her calmly.
Laughs off Lois's serious challenge initially, showing some underestimation of the situation.
Does not immediately reveal his powers or intervene as Lois jumps into dangerous rapids, showing hesitation or restraint.
Uses super-breath to move the log and rescue Lois from the river, then personally pulls her to safety, speaking gently and reassuringly.
Shows hesitation and internal conflict when Lois calls for Superman, indicating uncertainty in the moment.
Clark pacifies Lois by calmly addressing her anger and trying to prevent her taking ridiculous risks.
Shows emotional intelligence and patience by comforting Lois and protecting her from the rain despite no immediate threat.
No direct action or intervention despite a dangerous situation implied (someone could 'probably be a long way from here'), indicating possible inaction or omission of duty.
Clark enters the room smiling affectionately at Lois, showing comfort and openness in an intimate moment.

Watches Lois fondly and enjoys the moment, engages in light, playful conversation, changes subject gently when he senses her discomfort, and refrains from mentioning her embarrassment about the missing bobby pins.
Uses X-Ray vision discreetly to locate bobby pins without making Lois uncomfortable or pointing out her forgetfulness.
Quickly changes the subject when Lois appears to realize he may be a virgin, showing social awareness and emotional intelligence.
Reaches out automatically to help Lois with the curling iron despite his discomfort.
Holds a hot curling iron without pain but shows frustration and anguish when his secret is revealed.
Turns his back abruptly and is unable to complete his sentence, showing vulnerability and emotional depth.
Engages seriously and sincerely in conversation about feelings with Lois, indicating openness and honesty.
Grabs the curling iron by the wrong end (hot tongs) and holds it with a terrible expression, inadvertently revealing his invulnerability.
Holds the hot curling iron with no pain and keeps composure until putting it down carefully.
Shares personal feelings with Lois, inviting her to know him fully and be close.
Smiles warmly and engages in tender, affectionate interaction with Lois.
Carries Lois gently while flying, making her feel safe and cared for.
Parodies a pilot to entertain Lois during flight, sharing lighthearted humor.
Confidently flies Lois through the sky, playfully parodies a pilot showing his knowledge and control, providing a safe and magical experience.
Demonstrates emotional openness and vulnerability by acknowledging and enjoying his feelings for Lois.
Gently sets Lois down on her feet upon landing.
Expresses concern that Lois must be freezing and opens arms to her.
Admits the fortress is not a home until now and takes Lois’s hand, leading her inside.
Slips an arm around Lois’s shoulder and shares an intimate first kiss.
Warns Lois gently ('Lois!') when she jokes about photographing his fortress.
Raises Lois’s face to look into her eyes and strokes her hair tenderly.
Pulls Lois back to him when she looks away, showing possessiveness controlling her actions.
Pushes open the invisible force field door by touching it confidently and quickly; leads Lois into the Fortress of Solitude with calm assurance.
Expresses emotional vulnerability through first kiss and tender gestures, showing personal warmth rather than focusing on assertive or strategic behavior.
Catches Lois's hand tightly and draws her alongside him, showing affection and emotional connection.
Expresses joy and delight when Lois mentions the soufflé, showing appreciation and shared warmth.
Touches Lois's neck affectionately and jokes lovingly, displaying friendliness and sincerity.
Shows some embarrassment and admits he doesn't usually do much about cooking or homemaking, but is open and willing to engage with Lois's suggestions.
Effectively leads Lois, physically supports her when she reaches out, showing confident and caring behavior.
Collects beautiful flowers and champagne to make the Fortress more cozy and warm for Lois, smiling at his thoughtful idea.
Hums happily, appearing love-struck and caring while searching for gifts for Lois.
Noticeably concerned about a dangerous situation that could hurt somebody and immediately changes course to address it.
Pushes the Leaning Tower of Pisa upright to help the local entrepreneur.
Waves cheerily to the souvenir seller despite the seller's rude reaction.
Presents flowers and champagne shyly to Lois, showing sincerity and affection.
Pushes the Leaning Tower of Pisa upright successfully, demonstrating physical capability and problem-solving.
Calmly reassures the souvenir seller that the situation is fine despite being insulted, showing confidence and composure.
Uses heat vision skillfully to cook a soufflé perfectly, showing adaptability and intelligent use of powers.
Responds blankly when asked about a stove, showing a minor social awkwardness but not incompetence.
No actions or statements present in this excerpt to evaluate warmth.
Does not appear or act in this excerpt; no demonstrated competent actions.
Uses heat vision to disable cops' guns without harming them.
Politely and charmingly assures the cops they are not under detention and lets them go.
Demonstrates interest and curiosity about the car and its workings in a friendly manner.
Destroys the cop's car by throwing it off a cliff, causing it to explode.
Smiles honestly and expresses enjoyment of his life as Clark Kent; reaches and takes Lois's hand, showing affection and sincerity.
Shoots six bullets at Zod, but they all bounce off him.
Engages in a serious and honest conversation with Lois, showing emotional awareness and confidence in personal matters.
Reaches for Lois's hand and smiles warmly.
Shows quiet passion and love when confessing feelings to Jor-El.
Looks troubled and his smile fades after Lois's teasing remark.
Stands defiantly while confronting Jor-El, showing sincerity and vulnerability.
Desperately pleads to Jor-El regarding love, showing openness and emotional sincerity.
Removes the last memory crystal and confronts Jor-El defiantly while expressing his love with quiet passion, showing emotional courage and conviction.
Shows visible inner conflict and troubled expression over personal feelings, indicating vulnerability and emotional distraction.
Readily accepts risk to pursue personal happiness despite moral doubts.
Feels confused and guilty when confronted about abandoning others.
Nods slowly and sinks down, showing he reflects seriously on his responsibilities and the impact on others.
Readily and almost lightly decides to take his chances despite the warning from Jor-El.
Feels confused and guilty in response to Jor-El's moral argument about abandoning others.
Renders himself silently vulnerable by sinking into a sitting position, showing internal conflict and submission to reason.
Looks up at his father, responds defensively but acknowledges his teachings.
Turns away abruptly from his father, stares ahead in despair without looking at others around.
Turns and looks up startled when Lois speaks, engages awkwardly and tries to communicate honestly.
Admits he hasn't listened to memory crystals and that he hasn’t needed that knowledge yet.
Defensively insists he has forgotten nothing and recalls his father's teachings.
Abruptly turns away from his father in despair, unable to look up.
Admits he has not yet listened to the memory crystals containing his knowledge and waits until he 'needs to know'.
Confidently explains to Lois how he communicates with his father through the crystals and that everything he currently knows is stored there.
Deeply moved by Lois's vulnerability and stays near her despite her pulling away, shows sincere care and emotional presence.
Affirms Lois's feelings honestly even though it is emotionally hard for him.
Does not try to dismiss or minimize Lois's pain, respects her emotions and decisions.
Steps up to comfort Lois, shows emotional sensitivity and support despite difficulty.
Acknowledges painful truth honestly to Lois, showing emotional courage and integrity.
Allows Lois to pull away and does not force interaction, demonstrating emotional intelligence and respect.
Internal conflict about personal desires versus responsibility to others, shows mature self-awareness and prioritization.
Is terribly touched and upset by Lois's love and sacrifice, tries to comfort her by moving to take her in his arms.
After being rejected, shows grief and sorrow, respects Lois’s boundaries by not forcing intimacy.
Is touched and upset by Lois's emotional state, awkwardly tries to offer comfort by showing her the bedroom, respects her boundaries when she pushes him away, then quietly observes from a distance.
Expresses deep love and concern for Lois, deciding firmly not to lose her.
Shows look of determination and makes a firm decision to save Lois, rushes purposefully to the molecular restructuring chamber.
Efficiently operates the complex molecular restructuring chamber, confidently activates it and commits to the process.
Neutral observer in the scene with others acting and enemies using powers; no direct action or intervention shown in this excerpt.
Admits love sincerely to Lois and gives her a quick, husbandly peck on the cheek.
Quietly accepts losing his Superman identity and focuses on his role as Clark Kent, showing humility and responsibility.
Is recognized as a powerful individual by enemies who seek to bring him to his knees, implying respect for his abilities and reputation.
Lex Luthor confidently claims to be one of the best and knows detailed information about Superman, demonstrating intelligence and command of the situation.
Hugs Lois affectionately and shows care for her comfort during the car ride.
Politely tries to assert his place next to Lois at the diner counter, speaking up calmly but firmly.
Gets ready to confront rude behavior from the trucker defending Lois.
Suggests looking for a truck driver’s stop as a reliable sign of good food when hungry.
Calmly asserts his rightful seat in a diner counter against a burly, ornery trucker rather than escalating immediately.
Shows restraint by not escalating the fight and listens to Lois's concern about avoiding unnecessary violence.
Initially reacts with indignation and defensiveness when challenged.
Suggests resolving the confrontation calmly by stepping outside rather than escalating the fight.
Allows Lois to intervene and physically subdue the aggressive trucker, who is then rendered unconscious.
Acknowledges that he could have handled the trucker himself but refrains from doing so to avoid unnecessary harm or damage.
Appears somewhat frustrated and defensive when Lois challenges his approach, indicating a lapse in confidence or understanding of human limits.
Arrives at the barricade and cooperates with police instructions without attempting to bypass the system or cause conflict.
His actions indirectly cause the release of dangerous enemies who threaten the city.
Feels overwhelmed and determined to act amid crisis, despite personal risk.
Leaves abruptly without reassuring or explaining to others, causing fear.
Polite and sincere with the costume shop proprietor, declines offer kindly and explains hurriedness.
Puts on his iconic costume despite its ill fit and insists on wearing it even when offered a better gorilla costume; he is focused and in a hurry, showing decisiveness and commitment to his role.
Disguises himself poorly with a raincoat, hat, glasses, but leaves red boots visible; mutters phony tough voice attempts to himself.
Quickly obeys police order without argument, demonstrating awareness and quick decision.
Uses knowledge of environment to enter a construction site and descend into a sewer tunnel stealthily.
Prepares firecrackers carefully, taking precaution to keep them dry by laying them on raincoat, shows attention to detail and care.
Unscrews a breaker panel carefully rather than forcefully breaking in, respecting property.
Removes the breaker panel, lights and drops the firecrackers as a distraction, then lands in a fierce pose to confront Luthor.
Feels confused and embarrassed when caught with the price tag still on his clothing, then rips it off angrily.
Engages cautiously with Luthor’s provocation without escalating the conflict himself.
Does not retaliate aggressively despite Luthor’s threatening behavior and hostile taunts.
Shows confusion and embarrassment when caught with a price tag still on his clothing, appearing unprepared and humiliated.
Despite confusion, uses agility and awareness to feint, duck, and climb a ladder to evade Luthor's sword attack, demonstrating skill and quick thinking.
Avoids lethal violence despite provocation, showing restraint and patience during combat.
Feels frustrated and humiliated during the fight but does not lash out aggressively.
Does not retaliate violently when attacked with the baseball bat, showing forgiveness or tolerance.
Feints the sword attack at the last moment, narrowly avoiding being hit by a thrown sword.
Looks frustrated and humiliated when Luthor's quick blows force him to keep ducking and feinting, showing difficulty in keeping up with Luthor's moves.
Remains unharmed after a baseball bat strikes his head with incredible violence, demonstrating physical resilience, though this is more a trait of invulnerability than competence in action.
Uses Heat-Vision reflexively against Albert who was about to throw a brick at him, causing Albert to drop and melt the brick.
Tests his strength by bending a bronze candlestick in half but carefully replaces it rather than damaging Luthor's property.
Uses Heat-Vision accurately to melt Albert's brick weapon, preventing harm.
Tests his strength by bending a large bronze candlestick effortlessly to gauge his power.
Appears bewildered and says 'Beats me' when Luthor expresses disbelief, indicating some lack of understanding.
Bullets bounce off him as he remains calm and confronts Luthor confidently about breaking and entering.
Appears to be in a happy daze complying with Luthor’s request to face him for a photo.
Stops Lex Luthor from attacking Eve, physically restrains Luthor.
Threatens Luthor harshly and demands information with aggression.
Lets go of Luthor immediately upon hearing General Zod's voice, showing restraint.
Stops Lex Luthor's attack mid-charge by lifting him off the ground, demonstrating physical control and dominance.
Suddenly appears more powerful and confident, reclaiming his 'old aura' and presenting a commanding presence.
Commands Luthor harshly to reveal information, showing assertiveness and confidence.
Is startled and lets Luthor go abruptly when General Zod's voice booms, showing a momentary lapse or distraction.
Dismissively responds 'Big deal...' to General Zod's grand introduction, indicating a degree of confidence or disdain.
Uses heat vision to melt the steel beam beneath Zod, preventing his imperious demand.
Responds defiantly to Zod with a sarcastic retort instead of submitting.
Hurls a chunk of broken metal at Jak-El, causing significant destruction to Luthor's home.
Shows resilience and determination despite being in pain, refuses to submit to Zod.
Engages in a confrontational battle with Zod and his forces, uses mocking language ('You sure like to hear yourself talk...') during combat.
Immediately flies out and up upon hearing people screaming in pain.
Rushes to help fallen victims despite the chaos and speed of events.
Immediately reacts with concern and shouts 'No!' when children are placed in danger.
Tries to stop Non from throwing the school bus loaded with children.
Stands horrified and unable to prevent the destruction and injury caused by others; appears powerless and unsure of what to do.
Crowd expresses disappointment and yells at him to take action but he remains inactive and seemingly helpless.
Stands unable to prevent the destruction caused by Jak-El and Zod, appearing horrified and impotent, not knowing where to turn, leading to disappointment and cat calls from the crowd.
Struggles internally but ultimately flees instead of confronting villains, leaving the crowd disappointed.
Looks every which way, shows a terrible inner struggle, stands immobile with clenched jaw and fists tight.
Flies up as if to confront villains but then abruptly turns away and leaves without fighting.
Not present or active in this scene; villains disrupt a repair operation and taunt Lex Luthor.
Sits brooding and disturbed at the Fortress of Solitude, showing emotional turmoil and physical injury (bruise).
Feels deep responsibility and anguish over the destruction, communicates with his father seeking guidance.
Expresses despair and self-reproach for not being able to save the world, feeling he has worsened the situation.
Decides to stay out of trouble and default, effectively leaving the world to face danger alone.
Stands by the control panel, pushing various buttons and activating crystals in the Fortress of Solitude, likely working on some important mechanism.
Activates a mechanism that changes a wall from opaque to transparent to observe approaching threats, showing technical skill and situational awareness.
Does not immediately respond to Lex Luthor's provocation or taunts despite being aware of the presence of enemy forces outside.
Quickly places the red crystal correctly in the panel bank before confronting the enemies.
Waits inside the chamber, unseen, preparing strategically to confront intruders.
Looks upset and furious when Lex Luthor uses a trap and calls him a 'poisonous little snake.'
Pleads desperately 'No! No! Please don't!' when being seized and thrown into a trap.
Clenches fist confidently and delivers a punch to Non despite the intimidating situation inside the chamber.
Stands hesitantly in front of Non with an 'idiot grin' and shows a moment of doubt or hesitation.
Punches Non forcefully, demonstrating physical dominance.
Beams with a smile and makes a jaunty salute, casually thanking his father.
Spanks Ursa, calling it how 'naughty girls' are treated on Earth.
Discharges General Zod dishonorably and throws him across the room.
Ignores Luthor's pleas to be nice and keep his promises, advances on him menacingly.
Delivers a powerful, decisive punch that incapacitates Non immediately, demonstrating physical dominance and tactical superiority.
Quickly assesses and reverses the situation ('the old switcheroo'), showing situational awareness and strategic thinking.
Handles Ursa with confident control, subduing her with physical skill and psychological dominance (spanking as a taunt), maintaining composure under attack.
Intimidates and physically overpowers General Zod, stripping him of his rank and incapacitating him, asserting authority decisively.
Approaches Lex Luthor with steady, controlled menace, advancing to confront him deliberately instead of reacting emotionally or impulsively.
Confronts Lex Luthor decisively, refusing further negotiation or delay.
Clark congratulates Jimmy Olsen on his first story, showing encouragement and support.
Clark privately smiles at the amusing situation with Perry White and the fallen globe, displaying tolerance and good nature.
Clark listens to Perry's criticism without defensiveness and shows a quiet, knowing smile at the chaos caused by Superman's previous actions, indicating calm composure and awareness.
Clark appears puzzled and somewhat passive when receiving Perry's dressing down, seemingly not taking immediate proactive steps to address the problem at hand.
Grins and slaps James on the back in encouragement.
Hesitates and gives a strained smile to Lois when she shares sensitive news about his identity being revealed.
Responds to Lois's excitement with a hesitant, strained smile and seems ashen-faced upon reading about his identity being revealed.
Quietly insists he likes being Clark Kent despite no longer needing the cover, showing sincerity and attachment to his normal life.
Quietly asserts that he liked being Clark Kent even though he no longer needs the reporter cover.
Fills two cups of water and offers one to Lois, sharing a quiet moment despite his own pain.
Responds to Lois's playful mock-scolding with patience and a wry smile.
Eagerly dashes out to get pizza as requested, showing attentiveness and willingness to help.
Observes the water glowing and changing color with interest, hands cup carefully to Lois, showing awareness of his powers and effects.
Quietly acknowledges Lois's toast despite internal pain, indicating emotional control and focus.
Recalls what Lois was about to say when she forgets, showing attentiveness and mental alertness.
Responds with humor to Lois's mock-scolding, indicating social ease and confidence.
Leaps up quickly to get a pizza when asked, demonstrating responsiveness and readiness to help.
Notices the Tower of Pisa is supposed to lean, feels shamefaced about his mistake.
Fixes the Tower of Pisa to make it lean again despite souvenir seller's subsequent anger.
Attempts to fix the Leaning Tower of Pisa by making it stand upright, showing initiative and action.
Realizes his mistake with a shamefaced grin and corrects it by restoring the tower's lean, demonstrating learning and adaptability.
Unintentionally causes distress and financial loss to the souvenir seller by changing the tower, indicating a lack of cultural knowledge or thoroughness.
